Homeless students are significantly more at risk of losing services during the COVID-19 pandemic. Below are information and resources that will help students experiencing homelessness during these uncertain times. Contact TEA with any COVID-19 specific questions at: TEA’s website: tea.texas.gov/coronavirus Email: disasterinfo@tea.texas.gov TEA COVID-19 Support and Guidance For TEHCY program specific questions or concerns, contact... span.span: Home » Texas Education for Homeless Children and Youth COVID-19 Resource Page

header.h1: Texas Education for Homeless Children and Youth COVID-19 Resource Page

section.p: Homeless students are significantly more at risk of losing services during the COVID-19 pandemic. Below are information and resources that will help students experiencing homelessness during these uncertain times.
Contact TEA with any COVID-19 specific questions at:
For TEHCY program specific questions or concerns, contact the TEHCY Support Center at:

ul.li:
TEHCY Hotline: 1-800-446-3142
TEHCY staff are available Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM

section.p: Find contact information for your local Homeless Liaison at Liaison Directory
section.h2: Texas Education for Homeless Children and Youth (TEHCY) McKinney-Vento Posters
section.p: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) has released new McKinney-Vento posters. There are two versions of the poster, one to assist parents of school-age youth and a second to assist unaccompanied youth. The posters are available in both English and Spanish.
Local Education Agencies (LEAs) can download the digital files below and post this information on their LEA homeless education program webpage.

LEAs should collaborate with their school staff and community partners (e.g. food pantries, faith-based organizations, local housing authorities, shelters, etc.) to share printed copies of this poster.

img.alt: Poster for Parents - English; Link to accessible PDF available in caption

li.br: Sample checklist for developing identification strategies and ensuring equitable at-home curriculum during COVID19 school building closures.

a.strong: Supporting Students Living in Motels and Hotels

li.br: Sample strategies and best practices for Local Education Agencies (LEAs) to support student residing in motels and hotels, during the COVID 19 pandemic.
Sample Identification tool that will provide increased awareness of possible indicators and risk factors of students and families experiencing homelessness during COVID-19.

ul.li:
Supporting Students Living in Shelters
Checklist with strategies and best practices for Local Education Agencies (LEAs) to support students and families living in shelters during COVID-19.
